txt.en: Instance: Threat of a Good Punch

'We are almost there, [placeholder]. I will do the talking... but you should look as ferocious as you are able!\n\n'Hopefully this will not lead to violence, but if it does I will leave the fighting in your capable fists!'

'We did it, [placeholder]! Well, you did, and I cannot thank you enough! It seems it's good to have a Brawler around when there's rough fellows that need sorting!\n\n'Leave them be, my new friend. Those knocks and bruises will teach them not to mess with us!'
'I don't want anything to do with you, Brawler. But you're going to want to watch out for Bill Ferny. He never forgets, that one.'
Derwent Bindweed of Bree-town has requested a Brawler of fierce mien to stand beside him when he meets with a number of ruffians thinking to cheat him of his wages.
Under the cover of darkness you have come with Derwent Bindweed to the meeting place in southern Bree-town.
Under the cover of darkness you have come with Derwent Bindweed to the meeting place in southern Bree-town.
Under the cover of darkness you have come with Derwent Bindweed to the meeting place in southern Bree-town.
Stand by Derwent Bindweed and look fearsome
You have helped Derwent Bindweed stand up to Bill Ferny's demands.
Defeat Bill Ferny's rough fellows
Talk to Derwent Bindweed
Walk with Derwent Bindweed to the meeting
'You'll regret this, Bindweed!'
'And you too, Brawler!'
'I choose to let Mal speak for me on this matter, Bindweed.'
'Same as you're doing with this Brawler, I expect.'
'Supposed to scare us?'
'What do you think, Mal? Does this Brawler scare you?'
'Are you ready to be reasonable, Bindweed?'
Talk to Derwent Bindweed
'It's only money, after all.'
'What took you so long, Derwent? We've been here nigh on an hour!'
'Pox and curses! You'd better get this in hand, Mal!'
'You're not alone, though, are ya?'
'Okay, [placeholder], get ready. They're already here.'
'I want that Brawler dead!'
'Told you to come alone, didn't we, boys?'
'I'm here! Just as I said I'd be!'
'Dead, Mal! Dead!'
'No sir, Mister Ferny.'
'If Ferny has a problem with me, why doesn't he speak up? I see you there, Bill!'
'Get 'em, boys!'
'Seems my Brawler is embarrassing your ruffians, Bill!'
'You heard the man! Don't hold back! Knock that Brawler down!'
'What do you have to say now, Bill?'
'But sir...'
